intro: Canthium macrostipulatum, commonly known as the large-stipule canthium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, dry fruits called capsules, which contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
